He moved to NNP York and worked as a manual laborer and journalist while writing his first two novels , which were not successful . He married in 1930 and moved back to California with his wife . His first novel , Tortilla Flat , about DT comic antics of several rootless drifters who share a house in California , was published in 1935 . DT novel became a financial success . Steinbeck ’s next works , In Dubious Battle and Of Mice and Men , were both successful , and in 1938 his masterpiece DT Grapes of Wrath was published . DT novel , about DT struggles of an Oklahoma family who lose their farm and become fruit pickers in California , won a Pulitzer Prize in 1939 . After NNP War II , Steinbeck ’s work became more sentimental in such novels as Cannery Row and DT Pearl . He RB wrote several successful films , including Forgotten Village ( 1941 ) and Viva Zapata ( 1952 ) . He became interested in marine biology and published a nonfiction book , DT NNP of Cortez , in 1941 . His travel memoir , Travels with Charlie , describes his trek across DT NNP NNPS in a camper . Steinbeck won DT Nobel Prize in 1962 and died in NNP York in 1968 .

text: Between 542 and 66 million NNS ago — long before DT “ supervolcano ” became part of Yellowstone ’s geologic story — DT area was covered by inland seas . NPS / Jim Peaco Most of NNP ’s history ( from DT formation of DT NN 4.6 billion NNS ago to approximately 541 million NNS ago ) is known as DT Precambrian NN . Rocks of this age are found in northern Yellowstone and in DT hearts of DT Teton , Beartooth , Wind River , and Gros Ventre ranges . During DT Precambrian and DT subsequent Paleozoic and Mesozoic eras ( 541 to 66 million NNS ago ) , DT western NNP NNPS was covered at times by oceans , sand dunes , tidal flats , and vast plains . From DT end of DT Mesozoic through DT early Cenozoic , mountain - building processes formed DT Rocky Mountains . During DT Cenozoic era ( approximately DT last 66 million NNS of NNP ’s history ) , widespread mountain - building , volcanism , faulting , and glaciation sculpted DT Yellowstone area . Magma ( molten rock from NNP ’s mantle ) has been close to DT surface in Yellowstone for more than 2 million NNS . Its heat melted rocks in DT crust , creating a magma chamber of partially molten , partially solid rock . Heat from this shallow magma caused an area of DT upper crust to expand and rise . DT Yellowstone Plateau became a geomorphic landform shaped by episodes of volcanic activity . Stress RB caused rocks overlying DT magma to break , forming faults and causing earthquakes . Eventually , these faults reached DT deep magma chamber . Magma oozed through these cracks , releasing pressure within DT chamber and allowing trapped gases to expand rapidly . A massive volcanic eruption then occurred along vents , spewing volcanic ash and gas into DT atmosphere and causing fast super - hot debris ( pyroclastic ) flows on DT ground . As DT underground magma chamber emptied , DT ground above PRP sunk , creating DT first of Yellowstone ’s three calderas . This diagram shows DT general ideas behind two theories of how magma rises to DT surface . Adapted with permission from Windows into DT NNP by Robert Smith and Lee J. Siegel , 2000 . Based on minerals from DT last major eruption , DT researchers found IN DT changes leading up to an eruption MD happen in a matter of decades rather than thousands of NNS in advance as previously thought . Supervolcanoes are characterized as volcanic centers WDT have had eruptions WDT covered more than 240 cubic miles . DT NNP has two : CD in Yellowstone and another in California ’s Long Valley . An eruption MD emit ash WDT MD expand over 500 miles . DT eruption MD likely cover DT ground with as much as 4 inches of gray ash , which MD be detrimental to crops growing in DT Midwest . Another less worrisome concern is DT 1,000 degree F molten lava WDT MD ooze out . Gases , including sulfur dioxide , which contributes to acid rain MD be spewed from DT supervolcano and DT JJ cooling issues associated with reflecting sunlight away from DT NNP are RB concerns . But EX are other supervolcanos in DT NN with sooner predictions than Yellowstone ’s . Campi Flegri , a name WDT aptly translates as “ burning fields , is in a “ critical NN , ” according to researchers in Italy . PRP consists of a vast and complex network of underground chambers WDT formed hundreds of thousands of NNS ago , stretching from DT outskirts of Naples to underneath DT Mediterranean NNP . Though its last eruption was in 1538 , PRP ’s due for an eruption soon . PRP MD be a minor event compared to DT 72 cubic miles of molten rock PRP spewed in its most notorious eruption 39,000 NNS ago , called Campanian Ignimbrite , WDT likely contributed to DT extinction of DT Neanderthals . Fortune website article reported IN if DT Yellowstone supervolcano erupts , PRP MD shoot out more than 1,000 cubic kilometers of rock and ash into DT air . DT ’s 250 cubic miles . DT ’s more than three times as large as DT Campanian Ignimbrite eruption in Italy , which created a sulfurous cloud WDT floated more than 1,200 miles away to hang over Russia . DT ’s 2,500 times more material than Mount St. Helens expelled in 1980 , killing 57 NNS . An eruption at Yellowstone MD result in a cloud of ash more than 500 miles wide , stretching across nearly DT entire western NNP NNPS . NASA has a plan to neutralize supervolcano threats however . PRP believe DT most viable solution MD be to drill up to 6 miles down into DT supervolcano , and pump down NN at high pressure . DT circulating NN MD return at a temperature of around 662 F , thus slowly day by day extracting heat from DT volcano . And while such a project MD come at an estimated cost of around $ 3.46 billion , PRP comes with an enticing catch which MD convince politicians to make DT investment . PRP MD become a source of geothermal NN . But EX are considerable risks , too . PRP MD trigger DT eruption PRP ’s meant to save PRP from . Historically , four types of volcanic events have taken place in Yellowstone ( PRP MD click on each NN to learn more ) : 1 . Caldera Forming Eruptions — 2.1 and 1.3 million NNS ago 2 . Lava Flows — about 30 between 640,000 and 70,000 NNS ago 3 . Earthquakes — 1000 to 3000 yearly ; last notable quake was in 1959 4 . Hydrothermal ( Steam ) Explosions — small explosions in DT 20th century ; a dozen or so major explosions between 14,000 and 3,000 NNS ago DT likelihood of an eruption in DT near future is still low . However those who instigate such a project will never see PRP to completion , or even have an idea whether PRP might be successful within their lifetime . Cooling Yellowstone in this manner MD happen at a rate of 3.2808399 feet a NN , taking of DT order of tens of thousands of NNS until just cold rock was left . text: While a majority of Americans are dancing in DT streets over Donald J. NNP becoming their next NNP and “ Making America Great Again , ” EX are those in DT Environmental movement and DT Scientific community , WDT are expressing their concerns . Some concerns are justified , while other concerns WDT are being voiced raise a “ Red Flag . ” PRP have to wonder how much of these expressed concerns are paranoia from those of “ left leaning ” political views … those with “ Junk NNP ” in their portfolios ( CYA ) … and still others with an agenda WDT will not hold up under DT light of day . Some environmental planners spend their careers mapping out worst - case scenarios . As of January 20 , PRP ’ve got CD in DT White House . EX ’s a case to be made IN DT NNP Administration ’s rollback of environmental regulation wo n’t be devastating ; IN market forces will prevail in DT coming NN revolution ; IN DT environment and JJ NN will continue to be protected under DT EPA and other agencies , and IN NN governments will do their part as well ; and IN a newly - elected NNP , self - branded as an astute businessman and dealmaker , will be open to DT wisdom of ensuring a safe and healthy America . But EX are two fatal flaws with this argument : 1 ) PRP were n’t born yesterday ; and 2 ) PRP do n’t come to this page to be lied to . DT NNP Administration ’s cabinet nominees and transition staff are a wall - to - wall collection of zealots , ideologues and latter - day Robber Barons . Their collective message , both stated and implied , is IN DT American NN ’s ability to protect DT environment , already besieged and underfunded , is on DT brink of oblivion . In early December , DT cavalcade of aspirants and celebrities seeking an audience at NNP Tower included two high profile NN activists , former Vice NNP Al Gore and actor Leonardo DiCaprio . Gore ’s visit was brokered by DT First Daughter - Elect , Ivanka NNP . DT NNP Administration ’s cabinet nominees and transition staff are a wall - to - wall collection of zealots , ideologues and latter - day Robber Barons . Upon exiting , Gore told DT press gaggle IN meeting with DT Trumps was “ extremely interesting . ” Combined with NNP ’s declaration to DT NNP York Times IN he had an “ open mind ” about NN NN , DT wilted spirits of environmentalists were revived . Kudos to Gore and DiCaprio for making their case , but now , let ’s return to NN reality . He ’s not let them down , helping to lead a battle — against DT agency he ’ll be in charge of if approved — on DT Clean Power Plan , DT Waters of DT NNP NNPS definition ( WOTUS ) . WOTUS and DT Clean NNP Act hold a particular irony , since DT anticipated assaults on Section 404 of DT Clean NNP Act MD make PRP easier to drain real , not metaphoric , swamps from coast to coast . A day after Gore ’s meeting , NNP announced DT nomination of Oklahoma Attorney General Scott Pruitt ( Pictured left / Credit : Gage Skidmore / flickr ) to lead DT Environmental Protection Agency . In his six NNS on DT job in Oklahoma , Pruitt has enjoyed DT support of keystone local industries , including fossil fuel and poultry . NN : Next was ExxonMobil CEO Rex Tillerson , who vaulted past DT likes of Rudy Guiliani and Gen. David Petraeus for DT Secretary of NNP nomination . Months away from Exxon ’s mandatory 65 NN - old retirement age , Tillerson was a man in search of a hobby . Tillerson has acknowledged IN human - caused NN NN is real , and has endorsed both a carbon tax and DT Paris NN agreement . He ’s an Exxon lifer , with 41 NNS in DT employ of a corporation WDT ’s buried its own NN affirming NN NN , and WDT still funds NN denial groups . But do n’t VB he ’s inexperienced in NN or foreign policy . Steve Coll ’s must - read 2012 book “ Private Empire ” makes DT compelling case IN Exxon functions as a sovereign petro-state , leveraging diplomatic pressure in virtually every corner of DT NNP . All told , DT CEO of Exxon looks to be DT most progressive voice on NN NN in DT NNP Administration . DT CEO of Exxon . As Elizabeth Kolbert , DT Pulitzer - winning NNP Yorker writer observed , “ PRP have to be pretty desperate – and at this point JJ NNS are – to take this as cause for optimism . ” Related : He ’s no Ronald Reagan DOE : Editorial cartoonists and late - night comics love Rick Perry , who , as its potential boss , probably now remembers IN Department of NNP was CD of those agencies he ’d VB to abolish . DT former Texas governor is actually a big fan of wind power , which he watched become a booming industry in his NN . “ PRP can be proud IN Texas produces more NN from wind turbines than all but five NNS , ” he boasted upon leaving office in 2015 . He ruled over a bonanza in Texas fracking as well , and last NN joined DT Board of Directors of NNP Transfer Partners , DT builders of DT Dakota Access Pipeline . Perry ( Pictured left / Credit : Gage Skidmore / flickr ) has RB VBN IN NN NN is a NN to keep NN NNS as wealthy as PRP all VBP IN PRP are . While DOE has been home to groundbreaking clean NN research , DT bulk of DT department ’s mission and budget goes to maintaining DT U.S. nuclear weapons stockpile , and cleaning up DT immense messes left by their manufacture . Since leaving DT Texas NNP House , Perry has kept himself busy with an unsuccessful appearance on “ Dancing With DT Stars , ” and by turning back a criminal indictment for abuse of power as Governor . Step lightly , Guv . Interior : Ryan Zinke ( Pictured below / Credit : Gage Skidmore / flickr ) is a first - term Montana congressman who accepts IN NN NN is real . In DT past , he ’s called NN NN a “ threat multiplier , ” but IN Obama ’s NN strategies MD unleash “ catastrophic ” JJ costs . An avid hunter , Zinke says he ’d VB to see more intensive use of federal lands by both sportsmen and oil and gas drillers , and is expected to favor opening controversial export terminals to ship Montana and Wyoming coal across DT Pacific . He does have credentials as a “ hook and bullet ” conservationist , including support for DT crucial Land and NNP Conservation Fund . DT ’s earned him opposition from western anti-environment groups IN DT American Land Rights Association . He earned a 3 percent rating from DT League of Conservation Voters in 2015 . Unlike JJ on DT NNP team , he ’s voiced opposition for turning federal lands over to NNS . Rick Perry ruled over a bonanza in Texas fracking and last NN joined DT Board of Directors of NNP Transfer Partners , DT builders of DT Dakota Access Pipeline . Justice : If approved , Alabama Senator Jeff Sessions MD serve as Attorney General . He ’s VBN IN efforts to bring clean NN to developing nations MD be a veritable assault on DT NN ’s poorest NNS . He believes CO2 is a benign “ plant food , ” and famously launched a bizarre interrogation of EPA Administrator Gina McCarthy earlier this NN . Enough about DT NN / environment bosses . DT secondary players MD be considerably worse . JJ of these items are taken from first - rate reporting by Lyndsey Gilpin of High Country NNP , and research by Jenny Rowland and Erin Auel at DT Center for American Progress . DT CAP researchers documented IN nearly every key member of DT transition teams for EPA , Interior , and DOE worked for Koch - funded organizations or office - holders . NN : Thomas Pyle , a former lobbyist for both Koch Industries and DT National Petrochemical and Refiners Association , leads DT transition team . He currently runs DT Koch - and Exxon - funded Institute for NNP Research , a NN tank WDT ’s espoused a loosening of NN regulations and NN denial while denouncing wind NN . A special moment came on December 14 , when NNP transition team member Anthony Scaramucci appeared on CNN . Anthony Scaramucci , a financial CEO and Fox Business NNP contributor , mixed PRP up with CNN anchor Chris Cuomo in mid-December . Cuomo repeatedly asked his guest about whether NN NN is real . Citing Flat NNP Theory , Scaramucci took a deep dive into DT manufacture of doubt . Funny thing : Scaramucci was asked DT same question six months ago and declared NN NN to be “ irrefutable . ” For good measure , and possibly with his JJ boss in mind , he added back in June , “ I find PRP tragic IN so JJ NNS in this country believe JJ NN is some sort of elaborate hoax perpetuated by every credible scientist on DT NN . ” Other NNP Department transition officials include two more former Koch Industries lobbyists , Mike McKenna and Mike Catanzaro . Catanzaro RB served a stint as Communications Director for uber - denier Sen. James Inhofe . Team member William Greene is Deputy Legislative Director for DT Safari Club International , which has lobbied for trophy - hunting exemptions from DT Endangered Species Act . Transitioner Daniel Simmons comes from two Koch - funded groups , IER and ALEC . Somewhere on this DOE team , an unidentified someone has been “ counseled . ” Those were DT announced consequences for distributing a questionnaire to DOE employees WDT , among other things , sought to identify anyone at DT agency who had participated in NN - related meetings . After an uproar , and a refusal by current DOE staff to comply , DT NNP team disowned DT questionnaire and its McCarthy Era overtones ( In fairness to Senator Joe McCarthy , he was nowhere near as forgiving with DT Russians ) . NASA Transition head Chris Shank is DT # 2 staffer to House NNP Committee Chair Lamar Smith , and is expected to steer DT agency away from its vital NNP NN and NN NN research . Commerce : DT Commerce Department ’s National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration is NASA ’s NN counterpart in NN research . Commerce Secretary nominee Wilbur Ross has made billions on rescuing and leveraging distressed companies , including coal , oil and gas firms . He ’s acknowledged IN NN NN is a thing , offering suggestions to boost rail traffic and invest in ethanol as NN fixes . Ross ’s International Coal Group owned DT Sago Mine in West Virginia . In January 2006 , 13 miners were trapped in an explosion at DT mine . Only CD was rescued . In 2011 , Ross sold ICG to Arch Coal for a reported $ 3.4 billion . EX ’s little indication IN NOAA ’s NN NN is nearly as much in DT crosshairs as NASA ’s . But , as CD former Commerce official told me , “ maybe PRP just have n’t gotten to PRP yet . ” EPA : Myron Ebell is a veteran political operative guiding EPA ’s transition team . Ebell dodges DT “ denier ” label via a few old NN - denial standards : In DT past , he ’s either VBN IN NN NN is “ nothing to worry about , ” or IN PRP will be awesome when fewer NNS die from DT cold in a NN NN . When hackers stole thousands of emails from NN NNS in 2009 , Ebell described DT NN NN community as a “ gang ” WDT was “ without honor . ” Multiple investigations cleared DT NNS of any wrongdoing . RB on DT team are attorneys David Schnare and Chris Horner of DT American Tradition Institute . Schnare and Horner have specialized in filing lawsuits and sweeping Freedom of Information Act requests against prominent NN NNS . Bankruptcy filings by coal companies have revealed their funding for Schnare ’s and Horner ’s work . National Security Team : K.T. McFarland , ( Pictured left / Credit : Gage Skidmore / flickr ) another Fox contributor , MD become Deputy National Security Advisor . She ’s denounced DT Obama Administration for citing NN NN as a JJ security issue . Monica Crowley , still another appointee drained from Fox NNP , will handle DT press for National Security Advisor Mike Flynn . She recently called JJ NN “ a way of separating Americans and Westerners from God and organized religion , and PRP ’s RB a wealth redistribution scheme . ” CIA : Wichita - based Congressman Mike Pompeo counts on David and Charles Koch as his constituents . He ’s been a business partner with Koch Industries through an oil supply firm , and has VBN IN NNP Obama is “ horribly wrong ” about NN NN posing a JJ security risk . Interior : Doug Domenech is a former Virginia NN official who blames DT “ regulatory war on coal ” for tough times in Appalachia , and says IN DT miracle mineral can relieve NN poverty . But coal jobs have been on a steady swan dive since DT Reagan Administration due to mechanization . Other Interior transition staffers include attorney Daniel Jorjani , who works for DT Koch ’s Freedom Partners Chamber of Commerce . Authors Alyssa Katz describes this effort as having bankrolled anti-regulatory campaigns by DT U.S. Chamber and others with $ 255 million in 2012 alone . Congressional staffer Harlan Watson served as chief NN negotiator under NNP George W. Bush . A leaked memo from ExxonMobil , written shortly after Bush ’s inauguration , sang Watson ’s praises and recommended him for a role in NN policy . And a few more : As Transportation Secretary - designate , Elaine Chao MD lead on major infrastructure projects , including DT Obama Administration ’s plans to ramp up electric vehicle charging stations nationwide . Chao resigned her seat on DT Bloomberg Philanthropies Board in 2015 when DT charity decided to increase its support of DT Sierra Club ’s “ Beyond Coal ” campaign . She is married to Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell – a helpful reminder IN sometimes , guilt by association means IN PRP ’re guilty . Linda McMahon , nominee for DT Small Business Administration , has cited “ conflicting NN on both sides of this issue . ” DT former NNP Wrestling Entertainment executive did n’t VB so far as to declare NN NN is fake and has a predetermined outcome . Senior Counselor Steve Bannon ’s Breitbart NNP site regularly touts NN denial . Bannon accused DT Pope of “ hysteria ” for embracing NN action . Domestic transition head Ken Blackwell believes IN NN models are rigged , and DT NN is a “ hoax . ” HUD nominee Ben Carson has VBN EX ’s “ no overwhelming NN ” on NN NN . Chief of Staff Reince Preibus VBD “ melting icebergs are n’t beheading Christians in DT Middle East . ” UN Ambassador nominee Nikki Haley fought DT Clean Power Plan as South Carolina Governor , even as her NN endured lethal , record - smashing downpours . And Vice NNP - Elect Mike Pence has at times VBN NN NN is real , but IN NN policy can’t impact PRP . But he ’s RB called PRP a “ myth . ” About DT author : For questions or feedback about this piece , contact Brian Bienkowski at bbienkowski@ehn.org . text: In 1995 , a woman by DT name of Nancy Lieder claimed to have had contact with extraterrestrial beings known as Zetas . She was visited by CD of her “ hybrid sons ” and was being prepared for a role as a messenger for DT Zetas ( Zeta Talk ) . Nancy eventually quit her full NN job in California and moved to Wisconsin to pursue her JJ appointed position as messenger for DT Zetas ( Zeta Talk ) . Official information from DT Zetas can be found online at Zeta Talk . Since 1995 , DT Zetas have been revealing to Nancy plans PRP have for DT human race as well as predictions of future events and catastrophes . In DT early 2000s , Nancy made a wrong prediction of an event occurring and lost a large number of followers , yet a close knit following still remains . DT belief is extraordinary because DT only evidence is word of mouth . Nancy Lieder is DT only contact with DT Zetas . She proclaims JJ elaborate facts of realities not yet known to mankind and is quite thorough in their descriptions . So far , Nancy has been unable to accurately make predictions of future events stating IN DT Zetas can be wrong sometimes ( Zeta Talk ) . Nancy RB does not have any physical evidence of DT existence of Zetas , but in a video she posted on YouTube , she describes a scene she experienced with a Zeta in such great detail IN PRP MD be surprising if PRP were not real . But , again , DT impressive detail and other anecdotal visions is DT only evidence of Zeta existence . In DT eyes of those invested in DT belief , Nancy Lieder has asserted herself in a position of high credibility and authority through DT telling ’s complex rules to live by , predictions of catastrophes , and enlightened happenings of DT “ aftertime ” where alien - kind and humankind openly walk amongst each other . Nancy , as DT contact , uses modern events IN JJ NN as verification of DT Zeta ’s predictions , which her followers believe . Those who are devout in their belief are misinterpreting real evidence of earthly phenomena as doings of DT Zetas . EX is a consistent community of Zeta believers on social NN , and those WDT participate in DT community are actively adopting this belief more and more into their self concepts . In other words , DT belief is taking up residents in their personal identity , which means IN being a part of DT group who is becoming who PRP are . When multiple NNS commune with each other in this way , a bond is formed amongst DT group and PRP becomes larger than PRP are as individuals . CD of DT most prominent aspects of Nancy ’s messages is DT “ aftertime ” and what life after death will look IN . According to Terror Management Theory , NNS will pursue meaningful experiences as well as beliefs WDT buffer against DT fear of DT inevitability of death . Since Zeta ’s messages expand into description of life after death , JJ NNS find refuge in DT belief IN NNS will CD day live amongst aliens . “ Return to Main Page . ” WHO ARE DT ZETAS , www.grantchronicles.com/zeta02.htm.

text: In a " show of force , " DT U.S. Navy dispatched an aircraft carrier and five escort ships to DT South NNP NNP amid rising tensions between DT U.S. , NNP and other Southeast Asian nations claiming territory in DT disputed region , multiple defense officials confirmed to Fox NNP Friday . DT Navy Times reported Thursday DT U.S. sent DT USS John C. Stennis , two destroyers , two cruisers and DT 7th Fleet flagship . DT deployment comes after Defense Secretary Ash Carter warned NNP over DT militarization of its claimed artificial islands . DT Stennis was joined by DT Japan - based cruisers Antietam and Mobile Bay and destroyers Chung - Hoon and Stockdale , according to DT Navy Times . DT command ship USS Blue Ridge , is RB in DT area and is heading for DT Philippines . Officials VBD DT Antietam was conducting a separate patrol from DT Stennis . Tensions have increased over DT last month after PRP was learned IN NNP had placed surface - to - air - missiles on CD of DT Paracel Islands . Since DT incident , U.S. Pacific Command Chief Adm. Harry Harris has NN IN NNP is militarizing DT region . “ In my opinion NNP is clearly militarizing DT South NNP NNP , ” Harris testified on Feb. 24 . “ PRP ’d have to believe in a flat NNP to believe otherwise . ” DT U.S. has completed patrols within DT 12 - mile limit of NNP ’s artificial islands . Last October , DT destroyer Lassen went through DT region and on Jan. 30 , DT destroyer Curtis Wilbur sailed near Trinton Island , part of DT Paracel Islands . Carter took a harsh tone Tuesday speaking at a conference in San Francisco . DT U.S. and other Southeast Asian governments with rival claims , have expressed alarm over NNP 's island construction , saying PRP raises tensions , threatens regional stability and MD violate freedom of navigation and overflight . text: As DT consequences of light pollution have become more visible , lighting regulations have started to evolve . Canada passed bird - friendly lighting ( and construction ) laws in DT mid-1990s , and now numerous cities — including Toronto , Washington , D.C. , and NNP York — participate in lights - out campaigns during peak migration seasons . And in 2016 , DT American NNP Association responded to DT growing body of evidence suggesting IN intense LEDs are harmful to human NN by recommending IN communities VBP streetlights to “ minimize and control blue - rich environmental lighting . ” Entire cities are even re-doing their lights in an attempt to reclaim DT night and decrease NN waste . Flagstaff , Arizona , was DT first city to be designated a Dark Sky Community by DT International Dark - Sky Association , and Chicago is in DT process of retrofitting its fixtures . So far , hesitations about dimmer , sparser lighting causing an uptick in crime or decreased safety at night have not been supported by DT data ; in Chicago ’s West Garfield Park , more brightly lit alleys actually led to an increase in reported crime . And anecdotally , NNS are finding IN less glaring lighting makes PRP easier to see in unlit areas , because our eyes adapt more quickly to DT dark . For some cities , eliminating light pollution is RB a way to increase tourism revenue while strengthening humanity ’s connection to DT night sky . Consider DT town of Jasper , Alberta . Nestled in DT remote Canadian Rockies , Jasper is a haven for those who love DT mountains , wildlife , and DT outdoors . Just a few minutes drive outside town , stargazers can see a dazzling array of nighttime wonders , from oft - hidden stars and satellites to meteorites and DT aurora borealis . Since 2010 , DT city has hosted a Dark Sky Festival in DT fall WDT brings in thousands of NNS . But Jasper residents are n’t content to have DT nighttime wonders visible only just beyond their borders . DT town is now working with Lumican , a Canadian company WDT partners with DT International Dark - Sky Association , to re-do all its streetlights . Slated to start this summer , DT town ’s roughly 400 fixtures will be replaced with shielded Lumican LEDs set to color temperatures ranging between 1,700 and 2,200 Kelvin , which efficiently cast an amber glow while limiting more harmful blue wavelengths . “ What caught our attention at first was how horrible all these JJ LED street lights looked ; so glary , prison - UH , and overly bright , ” says Lumican ’s Lara Mitchell . When she realized IN such street lighting erases stars and damages ecosystems , DT company turned toward fighting light pollution . Throughout North America and Europe , dark sky parks are on DT rise , and festivals IN Jasper ’s are flourishing . NNS are beginning to reconnect with DT sparkling canvas WDT swirls overhead just as technologies are becoming available on scales WDT will help humanity reclaim more of this natural nighttime majesty — if PRP choose to use them . Christopher Kyba , DT scientist who studies light pollution on a JJ level , points to van Gogh ’s “ Cafe Terrace at Night ” as his image of an ideal nighttime scene . “ This is DT dream of what PRP VBP to have — nice , warm , uniform lighting . PRP can see lots of stars up above , DT facades are unlit , ” he says . “ PRP look a hundred - something NNS in DT past to see DT idealized lighting . ”

text: On Reddit , some “ Game of Thrones ” fans subscribe to a tortuous theory WDT a group of old , scholarly men — DT maesters — are part of a sprawling and hidden NN to exert control over DT show ’s mythical kingdom . PRP write thousands of words to each other proving IN every obscure clue adds up to a big picture WDT only PRP can see . Just a few clicks away , other Reddit users are sure IN a secretive group — DT Illuminati — is part of a sprawling and hidden NN to control DT real NN . PRP do exactly DT same thing . EX are some clear parallels between fan NN theories and political NN theories . PRP were once confined to DT far corners of American culture , but in recent NNS have flourished thanks in part to internet message boards and social NN , which offer anyone DT opportunity to publish , debunk , rebunk and remix their own imaginary concepts and share them with RB - minded theorists . DT theories , however , share more than just message boards . DT psychology of groups and DT internet ’s propensity to amplify outlandish content and reward DT NNS who create PRP has created DT kind of feedback loops in which bizarre theories — from both fantasy fans and DT politically paranoid — flourish . Russell Zimmerman , 41 , a writer , game developer and military historian , loves to theorize about “ Game of Thrones , ” particularly DT books on which PRP is based , George R.R. Martin ’s series , “ A Song of NNP and Fire . ” But some theories are even too much for him , such as CD WDT argues CD character ( Varys , DT spymaster ) is secretly a NN creature . “ To me , DT 's about DT level of ‘ out RB ’ crazy - talk as assuming EX 's a kiddie porn ring in DT basement of a pizza shop without a basement , ” he VBD , referring to DT “ pizzagate ” NN theory WDT remains popular on DT fringes of DT far right . “ Thrones ” is not DT only show with a strong internet following and crackpot theories . DT popular Adult Swim show “ Rick and Morty ” has various fan guesses at DT show ’s secrets . BBC ’s “ Doctor Who , ” which follows a NN - traveling human - looking alien exploring DT universe , has its own theories . And in DT early days of DT consumer internet , “ DT X - Files , ” a show WDT often touched on real - life NN theories , gave birth to some of DT first online fan theories . Meanwhile , any number of real - NN NN theories have taken hold among various political and social groups on DT internet . Joseph Uscinski , associate professor of political NN at DT University of Miami and author of “ NNP Theories and DT NNPS Who Believe Them , ” VBD diehard fans and NN theorists share a love of extrapolating from DT facts in their possession . “ NN theories are similar to fan fiction in IN PRP both allow NNS to make up whatever PRP VBP , ” he VBD . Uscinski VBD IN whether PRP ’s “ Game of Thrones , ” “ Star Wars ” or DT JFK assassination , NNS can take a plot or an event and “ VB to wherever PRP VBP with PRP . ” As an example , Uscinski cited Qanon , a remarkably popular genre of NN theories WDT generally center on a mysterious figure who claims IN NNP Donald NNP is working to uncover a powerful group of pedophiles . “ PRP have this anonymous poster , Q , who puts out nonsensical clues and NNS try to make sense of PRP and try to figure out what happens next , ” he VBD . “ PRP are enjoying this . PRP VBP piecing these things together . PRP ’s a fan thing for them . ” Brendon Boutin , 32 , who runs a popular “ Game of Thrones ” recap channel , “ Man of Recaps , ” VBD DT excitement generated by both kinds of theories drove their popularity . “ I VBP DT biggest similarity is DT feeling PRP VBP , DT rush of hunting for DT truth and discovering secret knowledge , ” Boutin VBD by email . “ I watched some 9/11 ‘ Truth ’ videos back in DT day , and those brought about DT same thrill as discovering Jon Snow 's parentage . ” “ Game of Thrones ” is far from DT only show to have a fervent fanbase WDT has created its own theories , but few have created a community as rich and active , both online and off . Laurel Steinberg , a NNP York - based relationship therapist , VBD DT behavior shown by NN theorists and superfans is “ absolutely analogous . ” “ NNS VBP to feel part of a group , part of a movement , part of a team , ” Steinberg VBD . “ PRP feels good to have something WDT gives them a identity . PRP feels good to have something to be excited about , and watch develop in real NN . ” But “ Thrones ” fandom is RB susceptible to DT same internet dynamics WDT have spurred ever - more outlandish NN theories , rewarding NNS who can draw DT most attention . “ PRP 're able to create community , and then become an expert . NN theories around politics and current events have inspired some NNS to commit acts of violence , which has led to efforts by politicians and activist groups to force internet platforms to reign in DT spread of DT disinformation WDT can fuel DT theories . “ When DT show comes out , NNS will disregard their theories WDT did n’t turn out to be true , ” he VBD . “ But with flat earthers , when PRP do an experiment and PRP does n’t show them what PRP VBP , PRP still hold DT belief anyway . Tsai 's pledge " contradicts " DT independence clause in DT DPP 's own charter , Wang VBD , adding IN she and DT DPP MD have to " prove ( DT DPP ) is not a Taiwan independence party " . " This is DT basis for cross - Strait exchanges , " VBD Wang , who is RB NN of DT All - NNP Federation of Taiwan Compatriots - a Chinese NN group composed of Taiwanese exiles , defectors and their descendants . DT DPP did not respond to a request for comment . text: “ DT folksiness will irk some critics … But criticizing Friedman for humanizing and boiling down big topics is IN complaining IN Mick Jagger used sex to sell songs : PRP is what he does well . ” – John Micklethwait , review of Thank PRP for Being Late , in DT NNP York Times With apologies to Mr. Micklethwait , DT hands WDT typed these lines implying Thomas Friedman is a Mick Jagger of letters should be chopped off and mailed to DT singer ’s doorstep in penance . Mick Jagger MD excite DT NN in CD note , while Thomas Friedman needs 461 pages to say , “ Shit happens . ” Joan of Arc and Charles Manson had more in common . Thomas Friedman was once a man of great influence . His columns were must - reads for every senator and congressperson . He helped spread DT globalization gospel and push PRP into war in Iraq . But he ’s destined now to be more famous as a literary figure . No modern writer has been lampooned more . Hundreds if not thousands of man-hours have been spent teaching robots to produce automated Friedman - prose , in what collectively is a half - vicious , half - loving tribute to a man who raised bad writing to DT level of an art form . PRP will remember Friedman for interviewing 76 percent of DT NN ’s taxi drivers , for predicting “ DT next six months will be critical ” on 14 occasions over two and a half NNS ( birthing DT neologism , “ DT Friedman unit “ ) , and for his unmatched , God - given ability to write nonsensical metaphors , IN his classic “ rule of holes ” : “ When PRP ’re in CD , stop digging . When PRP ’re in three , bring a lot of shovels . ” Friedman ’s great anti-gift is his ability to use JJ words when only a few are necessary . He became famous as a newspaper columnist for taking simple CD - sentence observations IN , “ Wow , everyone has a cell phone these days , ” and blowing them out into furious 850 - word trash - fires of mismatched imagery and circular argument . DT double - axel version of this feat was to then rewrite DT same column over and over again , in DT same newspaper , only piling on more incongruous imagery and skewing rhetoric to further stoke DT CD thought into an even higher and angrier fire . For nearly two decades now , Friedman has been telling PRP IN something big is happening , technology is growing at a rate beyond DT ability of humans to adapt ( this is where DT part about noticing everyone has a cell phone comes in ) , and IN PRP have to stop doing things DT old way and take a brave step into DT future . He wrote this column so JJ times IN even four NNS ago – eight Friedman units – Hamilton Nolan wrote a piece in Gawker titled “ Thomas Friedman writes his only column again ” ( Friedman ’s “ only column ” has by now outlived hundreds of NN outlets , Gawker and my own NNP York Press among them ) . Nolan cited a piece in DT Times called “ DT Rise of Popularism , ” in which Friedman argued , again , IN technology was racing past humanity ’s ability to govern itself wisely . A very conservative guess is IN Friedman has written this column at least a hundred times . Maybe 200 . Maybe more . If PRP ’re rolling your eyes at this , check yourself . VB about what an awesome accomplishment WDT is . PRP takes an extraordinary discipline to turn CD sentence of thought into hundreds of thousands of words . PRP all repeat ourselves in DT punditry business . Most of PRP only have a few ideas . Friedman has fewer than most – PRP ’s really just CD , technology future derp ! – but he ’s attacked IN CD idea with such relentless evangelical NN WDT he is leaving behind as a monument to PRP DT literary equivalent of DT Giza pyramid complex . This decades - long gigantic art project is based upon a vast architecture of needless complication , a process he describes in this JJ book of his , Thank PRP for Being Late , as “ translating English into English . ” Build a sentence into a column ; build a column into JJ columns ; build JJ columns into a book ; build CD book into JJ books . Then start over ! Eleven NNS ago , when Friedman wrote his seminal explainer book , DT NNP is Flat – a book whose title metaphor was hilariously based on DT wrong premise IN NNS are more interconnected on a flat NN than on a round CD – he combined two giant sets of metaphors to describe DT same idea IN technology was outpacing our ability to govern ourselves . He VBD rapid changes in DT NN were being fueled by 10 “ flatteners ” ( things IN DT end of communism , Netscape , outsourcing , etc. ) which in turn were amplified by he VBD were four “ steroids ” : Digital , Mobile , Personal and Virtual . Those four steroids actually turned out to be six – changing or extending DT terms of his imagery midstream is a classic Friedmanism – and DT sixth “ steroid , ” JJ wireless devices , was actually a JJ group of steroids he called “ uber-steroids . ” This was confusing because DT tenth item in Friedman ’s list of “ flatteners ” was DT group of four steroids . So his last flattener was a JJ group of steroids and his last steroid was a JJ group of uber - steroids . Which meant PRP had uber - steroids amplifying steroids amplifying flatteners , with each list comprising items WDT belonged to other lists . He mashed all of DT together for 470 pages or so . Eleven NNS and countless columns later , DT JJ book Thank PRP for Being Late takes DT same structure and boldly complicates PRP . This book is built , again , around DT idea IN technological NN is advancing beyond our ability to adapt . DT culprits this NN are three great “ Accelerations ” : Moore ’s Law ( microchip processing power doubles every 18 to 24 months ) , DT market ( globalization ) and Mother Nature , which is his English - language term for DT English - language term , “ NN NN and biodiversity loss . ” These Three Accelerations in turn are transforming five key “ realms , ” which he lists as “ DT workplace , politics , geopolitics , ethics , and DT community . ” If PRP ’re wondering what ’s left over when PRP subtract , from DT subset of all things , “ DT workplace , politics , geopolitics , ethics , and DT community , ” PRP ’re on to something . Because PRP turns out IN DT book is about how something is happening to – everything ! “ In short , ” Friedman says , in DT opening chapter of Late , “ this book is CD giant column about DT NN today . ” Incidentally , whenever Friedman uses DT phrase , “ In short … ” he ’s about to take DT short form of an idea and make PRP longer , e.g . “ In short , DT only way for Mexico to thrive is with a strategy of reform retail WDT will enable PRP to beat NNP to DT top , not DT bottom , because NNP is not focused on beating Mexico as much as PRP is on beating America . ” To his credit , in Thank PRP for Being Late , Friedman debuts DT use of , “ To make a short story long , ” which is n’t exactly fixing DT problem . But PRP is funnier . So how giant is this JJ giant column ? Really giant . EX are n’t enough drugs in DT NN to VB anyone through Thank PRP for Being Late in CD sitting . Take DT chapter about Mother Nature , which opens with a story about a day in July , 2015 when DT heat index in southern Iran reached 163 degrees . DT NN item gives DT author an opening to introduce DT concept of a “ black elephant , ” an ominous ( if PRP VBP Friedman ) term apparently explained to him by environmentalist Adam Sweidan : “ [ PRP is ] a cross between a ‘ black swan ’ – a rare , low - probability , unanticipated event with enormous ramifications – and ‘ DT elephant in DT room ’ : a problem WDT is widely visible to everyone , yet IN no NN wants to address , even though PRP absolutely VBP IN CD day PRP will have vast , black - swan - JJ consequences . ” PRP MD VB he MD just say , “ DT NN NN problem is a cross between a black swan and DT elephant in DT room – or , as I VBP to call PRP , a Black Elephant . ” Instead he leads audiences through drawn - out explanations of two everyday terms . Moreover his unnecessary definition of “ DT elephant in DT room ” contains DT phrase “ black swan , ” making what was originally a relatively simple idea now a kind of circular movie - within - a - movie image WDT is more than a little hard to follow : “ A black elephant is a cross between a black swan event and DT elephant in DT room , which is an ignored but visibly obvious problem WDT will inevitably become a black swan event . ” PRP ’re still grappling with DT when PRP learn “ EX are a herd of environmental black elephants out RB . ” Friedman names at least four : JJ NN , deforestation , ocean acidification and mass biodiversity extinction . He quotes Sweidan as saying of these : “ When PRP hit , PRP ’ll claim PRP were black swans WDT no NN MD have predicted , but in fact PRP were black elephants , very visible right now . ” Friedman just got finished telling PRP IN a black elephant is half black swan , and half elephant in DT room WDT will inevitably become a black swan . But now IN half - swan , half swan - within - an - elephant is being contrasted with a black swan : in DT near future , things WDT are really black elephants will be misidentified as black swans . So DT ’s weird . While PRP ’re sorting DT out , Friedman tells PRP IN DT PRP IN a 163 - degree heat index in Iran is another black elephant , because “ PRP can see PRP sitting in a room , PRP can feel PRP , and PRP can read about PRP in DT newspaper . ” He adds : “ IN any black elephant , PRP RB VBP IN PRP is so far outside DT norm IN PRP has all DT characteristics of a black swan – IN PRP is DT harbinger of some very big , unpredictable changes in our NN system PRP MD be unable to control . ” DT next thing he says is IN PRP spend tons of money preparing for DT relatively unlikely event of nuclear war , but virtually nothing to prevent a very likely NN NN catastrophe . He MD have just led DT chapter with DT . But DT MD defeat DT purpose of translating English into English . PRP ’re still wondering what happened to DT elephant reading a newspaper about a black swan roasting in DT desert when Friedman moves on to DT next space - devouring exercise , telling PRP about DT four phrases PRP need to master to learn “ NN - speak . ” All four sound IN DT same idea and are immediately forgettable : “ Just a few NNS ago … but then something changed . ” “ Wow , I ’ve never seen DT before . ” “ Well , usually , but now I do n’t VB anymore . ” “ PRP have n’t seen anything IN DT since . ” Quick , name any of those phrases PRP just read . PRP can ’t ! But PRP “ have to master ” all of them to grasp DT rapidity of NN disturbances , which Friedman now describes as Mother Nature moving into DT “ second half of DT chessboard . ” This is a reference to a metaphor from an earlier chapter recalling DT ancient tale of DT mathematician who asked a king for a reward . DT master asked to have CD grain of rice put on CD corner of a chessboard , and then to have twice as JJ put on DT next square , and to keep VBG , on and on to DT end . DT punchline is IN after doubling down 64 times , PRP end up with 18 quintillion grains of rice or something – more than PRP ’d have guessed ! Which is a metaphor for how much faster than PRP VBP is DT pace of NN all around PRP , be PRP in technology , JJ displacement or , in this case , DT environment . Did PRP VB IN “ megatoothed sharks prowled DT oceans ” DT last NN DT CO2 concentration in DT NN ’s atmosphere was as high as PRP was in Hawaii on NNP 3rd , 2013 , an astonishing four hundred parts per million ? PRP probably did n’t , because things WDT prowl usually have feet – but anyway , back to DT elephants : “ And sometimes DT records being broken as Mother Nature enters DT second half of DT chessboard are so numerous and profound , NN agencies tracking them seem to run out of even NN - speak to describe DT black elephants PRP are seeing . ” This must be DT talent for “ boiling things down ” WDT Mr. Micklethwait talked about ! God bless this man . MD he never stop writing books . Let ’s grow this pie as big as PRP can . P.S. winners of DT extraordinary # friedmangraphs contest to be announced soon . text: Detail from Nicolaes Visscher , Novissima et Accuratissima Totius Americae Descriptio , c . 1658 ( plate 1 ) . Over DT course of DT early modern period , DT ‘ space ’ of DT Netherlands opened up in several productive ways . Perhaps most famously , DT Dutch created DT JJ space of DT Republic : viable political space , demarcated from an older collection of provinces , which had been gathered most recently under DT auspices of DT king of Spain . DT Dutch RB expended tremendous effort reconstituting DT physical space of DT Low NNPS : land reclaimed from NN and increased urban centres , which allowed DT Republic to grow in population and gain in arable terrain . And DT Dutch enlarged their commercial and colonial space by dint of their numerous overseas expansions : a ‘ NNP ’ Netherland ( almost always referred to in singular form ) , which arose on DT eastern shores of what was already then called North America ; a modern ‘ Batavia ’ , which emerged in present‐day Indonesia ; and a host of Dutch forts and settlements WDT otherwise dotted DT coasts and islands of Asia , Africa and DT Americas . DT Dutch RB developed , just as famously , JJ pictorial devices to engage with space – DT painterly and printerly techniques explored in this issue – and , not unrelated , JJ techniques to map spaces : DT most robust cartographic ateliers of early modern Europe , which developed first in Antwerp and then in Amsterdam from DT late sixteenth century , coincident with DT rise of DT Dutch Republic and DT Golden Age of Dutch visual culture . Maps proliferated in DT early modern Netherlands . PRP offered a means both to delineate space and to narrate space – to explicate how space works and to assert where their makers ( and consumers ) fit within these spaces . Yet maps were RB important and ubiquitous material objects in DT Netherlands , which occupied myriad additional spaces and which played with DT JJ spatial and material concerns of their viewers . PRP engaged viewers and enticed them into their interpretive spaces . How do Dutch maps work , and what does this reveal about DT visual culture of DT early modern Netherlands ? These questions were famously tackled by Svetlana Alpers in DT Art of Describing mostly in regard to landscape painting . Yet in JJ ways , her influential essay on ‘ DT Mapping Impulse in Dutch Art ’ – DT NN ‐to source for non ‐Dutch specialists , particularly historians of NN who seek to affiliate their concerns with habits of natural ‐history representation with a broadly northern European tradition of painting – curiously avoided DT key to this intriguing interpretive palace : DT maps themselves and how PRP actually function . 1 While Alpers ’ oft‐cited chapter does open with Vermeer 's Allegory of Painting and DT impressive wall map by Claes Jansz . Visscher WDT amply fills its background , maps are otherwise relegated to DT side , treated sparingly and elliptically at best – at least DT form of artfully designed , lavishly embellished and meticulously printed maps WDT enjoyed such phenomenal popularity in DT Netherlands from DT late sixteenth through at least DT early eighteenth century . Maps do matter , and , as Alpers astutely points out , cartographic materials played a significant and instructive role in DT visual , social and indeed DT political culture of DT early modern Dutch Republic . PRP were ubiquitous in more ways than CD : as décor in houses and paintings ; as devices of learning and social standing ; as NN of cultural and political messaging . In a vital sense , however , these roles remain conspicuously absent in her analysis , inadequately problematized and not at all ‘ deconstructed ’ – to invoke DT language of DT JJ critical cartography WDT was being developed precisely when Alpers was formulating her insights into Dutch visual culture . 2 Maps as productive sources ( as opposed to theorized ‘ impulses ’ ) are only lightly glossed in Alpers ’ essay , their most superficial features brought to bear on a , by contrast , highly sophisticated argument about forms of ‘ mapped ’ landscapes ( as she terms PRP ) , best exemplified by DT flat panoramic paintings of Philips Koninck . This inverted theoretical focus distorts our perspective of Dutch ( and other ) maps and relegates to DT periphery an enormously dynamic visual source in DT early modern Netherlands . PRP RB irons out – unnecessarily – DT stimulating complexities of cartographic sources and DT promising possibilities of Alpers ’ implied query : what do maps offer to scholars of Dutch visual culture ? Rather than a ‘ flat working surface ’ , a Dutch map of this period was typically dense and jagged , presenting DT viewer with multiple angles of interpretive entry , as DT essays of this issue show for other NN and genres . Rather than offering a ‘ detached or perhaps even … culturally unbiased view ’ – can such a source ever be possible ? – these profusely layered artefacts furnish critical insight into and material evidence of DT visual culture WDT Alpers aims to address . 3 Early modern maps are delightfully thick objects and fundamentally material things . PRP illustrate modes of representation and craft , and PRP encourage various points of vision and interpretation . As PRP turns out , maps are anything but ‘ flat ’ . PRP richly demonstrate , in their own way , DT ‘ picturing impulse ’ of early modern Dutch culture . This brief intervention aims not so much to argue with Alpers as to consider a part of her argument WDT was left relatively under‐scrutinized : DT workings of Dutch maps . My goal is less to analyse how these maps work – EX is a vast and expanding literature WDT does just that4 – or even how PRP work in DT context of early modern Dutch painting , but rather to explore DT qualities of cartographic design WDT might speak to DT thematics of seeing and sensing pictures , so IN PRP might contribute , in this way , to DT broader understanding of Dutch visual culture WDT this issue sets out to explore . Maps are indubitably thick : PRP gesture relentlessly toward their materiality and to DT challenge their makers face in rendering into two dimensions what begins as three – DT same challenge confronted by Dutch painters , as several of DT essays gathered here so elegantly argue . Maps are theatrical : PRP stage JJ space in a profusely embellished form – PRP rarely offer mere , austere ‘ description ’ – and PRP dramatize for their viewers ways of processing both DT lands and waters of DT NN and DT things and events WDT occur within them . And – as this might imply – maps are narrational : PRP narrate spaces , frame histories and posit polemics – much IN Baroque theatre , to be sure , yet RB IN genres of painting of DT period , both in DT Netherlands and elsewhere . To demonstrate a few of these qualities , I turn , naturally , to a map : Nicolaes Visscher 's immensely popular Novissima et Accuratissima Totius Americae Descriptio ( first edition c . 1658 ; plate 1 ) , published more or less contemporaneously with Vermeer 's Allegory of Painting ( c . 1666–68 ) . Visscher 's printed map has an impressive history , VBG backward and forward , and touching as well DT key cartographic source of Alpers ’ inquiry . 5 Its original author was DT only son of Claes Jansz . Visscher , DT well ‐regarded cartographer who engraved DT wall map depicted in DT Vermeer Allegory . DT Visscher family RB had ties by marriage to DT illustrious Hondius firm , makers of DT Mercator atlases through DT first half of DT seventeenth century – PRP were thus kinsmen of mapping aristocracy – and their atelier in Amsterdam on DT Kalverstraat placed them in DT thick of all things cartographic . DT younger Visscher followed in his father 's professional footsteps and enjoyed considerable success , especially with his map of DT Americas . DT Americae went through several editions , RB in revised forms engraved by other ( sometimes competing ) ateliers ; PRP was appropriated for geography books , both as an insert and ( in a distilled form ) as a frontispiece ; and PRP was routinely copied and pirated outright , extending its successful run well into DT eighteenth century . 6 PRP became perhaps DT single most important early modern map of DT western hemisphere and certainly CD of DT most recognized images of DT NNP NNP . Its allegorical ( lower ) cartouche , moreover , became DT all ‐but standard representation of ‘ America ’ , an iconic image WDT crossed easily into other genres and NN . Nevertheless , despite its prestigious lineage and its titular promises of ‘ novelty ’ and ‘ accuracy ’ , DT map succeeded not so much for its exacting ‘ description ’ as for other , arguably pictorial reasons : for its highly embellished and appealing presentation of DT NNP NNP . DT actual cartographic content of DT map – DT particular delineations of DT lands and seas of DT western hemisphere – was scarcely JJ . PRP derived mostly from older materials , chiefly Joan Blaeu 's 1648 map of DT NN ; DT outlines of DT continents of these two maps are nearly identical . This habit of replication was not at all uncommon in early modern Dutch cartography ( as in other graphic arts ) , especially in DT sort of lavishly ornamented charts WDT became DT mainstay of Amsterdam ateliers . Nor can DT Visscher map make great claims for geographic meticulousness : a prominent ‘ California ’ floats off DT western coast of America , an island of DT mapmakers ’ imagination ; DT Great Lakes blend into CD truly great lake , which leaks its contents into DT Atlantic ; and DT long ‐sought Northwest Passage is offered optimistically as readily accessible , an open NN flowing freely into Asia . DT map 's promise of novelty and accuracy , in other words , is rhetoric – again , a fairly common ploy in early modern mapping ( as in late modern advertising ) . No Baconian empiricism here , but rather strategies WDT relate to DT techniques of rhetoric – pervasive across myriad Renaissance fields of enquiry – and to DT crafty practices of DT workshop . What likely sold DT map , more than its less ‐than ‐meticulous ‘ description ’ of DT continents , MD have been DT staging of DT Americae and DT ample ‘ adornments ’ WDT enriched Visscher 's product : DT four‐legged staffage WDT wander DT open , ultimately uncharted spaces of DT map ( what J. B. Harley famously called its ‘ silences ’ ) ; DT ethnographic vignettes WDT explicate DT NNP NNP 's indigenes ; and , not least , DT superb cartouches WDT fill DT upper and lower divisions of DT vast Pacific Ocean , at once distilling and framing DT continents in terms of space and narrative . 7 DT charming ‘ creatures in DT map ’ – these did not VB out of style in DT Renaissance – MD have appealed to a range of consumers . 8 Two handsome stag deer saunter across DT terrain of Eastern Canada ( Nova Francia on DT map ) ; PRP MD appear to await DT hunter 's arrow just as do DT tame deer of Ben Johnson 's poetic Penshurst or any other exemplary country house . A fox gambols across DT Great Plains ( a scene likewise redolent of DT Northern European countryside ) ; and beavers , coveted lately by Dutch merchants for their valuable pelts , pose obediently just inland of DT plainly demarcated empire of Nieu [ NNP ] Nederland .9 Further afield a pair of brown bears inhabit DT open , wild west ; meanwhile , a lone anteater has South America largely to himself . DT two‐legged staffage of tropical America – DT is , DT indigenous Americans – do no hunt any exotic fauna , but CD another . Their depiction in DT interior of Brazil , naked and engrossed in brutal warfare , offers a synoptic view of DT ‘ savage ’ Indian , here imagined as uncivilized if RB unobtrusive . As for DT pair of cartouches , CD occupying DT upper left and DT other DT lower left portion of Visscher 's print , these serve as DT dual anchors of DT map , DT dominant pictorial elements and DT keys to DT artefact 's interpretation ( plate 2 and plate 3 ) . PRP RB function to stage DT map 's motifs and – crucially – to elucidate its overall message . PRP is here IN both DT theatrical and narrative impulses of Dutch mapping come through most vividly and most pictorially . Both cartouches follow designs by Nicolaes Pietersz . Berchem , a highly regarded landscape painter , as PRP turns out ( and DT only son of Pieter Claesz , a master of still ‐life painting ) , who specialized in a form of idealized Italianate scenes popular in DT period ( a subgenre of Dutch landscape WDT lay conspicuously beyond Alpers ’ scrutiny as putatively un ‐Dutch ) . 10 DT pair of map vignettes work as an ensemble – DT device of DT parasol lures DT viewer 's eye from DT vignette below to DT balancing scene above – yet PRP is DT iconic figure of America herself , who gracefully gestures to DT map 's ‘ carved ’ title , WDT lies at DT heart of DT visual programme . Berchem at once allegorized and condensed DT essential qualities of DT cartographic space . He packed PRP all in : DT alluring personification of ‘ America ’ , decked out in a dainty feathered skirt and colourful feathered headdress ; DT pearls , barely visible around her neck , demonstrating DT region 's endemic richness ; DT classic bow and arrow , just to her right , alluding to her habit of hunting ( America RB bears a stylized club ) ; DT mounds of freshly mined gold ( or perhaps silver ) piling up at her feet , alongside stacks of ingots WDT indicate DT substantial mineral wealth of DT continent ; a pair of queerly coiled snakes , which reveal DT exotic naturalia of DT NNP NNP ; and DT central parasol , which shades America 's head from DT tropical sun.11 DT sum of DT parts tells DT story of DT whole : a massively rich , vaguely exotic , not ‐quite‐tamed NNP NNP . DT upper cartouche furnishes another allegory , which introduces a different angle on America , yet CD WDT is thematically complementary . A cluster of figures surrounds and supports a free‐floating , shield ‐like device , which bears a patron 's coat of arms and DT map 's dedication ( to Cornelius Witsen , a major supporter of overseas trade and exploration , on DT original NN , yet this varies with different printings ) . 12 DT predominant figure of this cluster , a European woman hovering in DT very upper‐left corner of DT map , represents Christian Faith : relatively plainly dressed , she points didactically with CD hand to a cross WDT she holds in her other hand and positions directly above DT other figures . She glances not to DT cross , however , but to a broad ‐shouldered , sharp‐taloned , demon ‐like figure below , who tumbles out of DT sky : an allegory of diabolism , ejected by DT Christian Church . An angel opposite and above gazes , mouth agape , at this falling devil and DT wondrous turn of events , while another heavenly figure , just to DT angel 's left , announces per clarion DT plunge of diabolism and DT spread of DT gospel . Finally , an Indian – DT figure situated closest to DT American landmass who wears DT same feathered headdress as DT principal ‘ American ’ figure of DT lower cartouche , in this way linking DT two vignettes – gazes in astonishment at DT allegory of Faith , whose good works have apparently converted him . DT cartouche recounts , in short , DT Church 's labours in DT NNP NNP : its presumed successes casting out false faiths and diabolisms , and evangelizing among DT American indigenes .13 To say IN these vignettes are staged is to identify both DT drama of Faith 's triumphs in DT NNP NNP and DT several marks of theatricality WDT hold DT ensemble together . DT parasol does this formally : not only does PRP lure DT eye upward , but PRP points directly to DT upper Indian ; were he to fall from DT sky , he might pierce himself on DT parasol 's tasselled spike . DT parasol functions , further , as a clever stage prop , a showy accoutrement WDT establishes DT ostentatious tropicality of America ( DT point of DT parasol abuts DT very words ‘ Tropicus Capricorni ’ ) . In fact , bona fide parasols commonly served as props in Baroque theatre ; and a particularly famous example of this , DT engraving of Anne Bracegirdle in her popular role as ‘ DT Indian Queen ’ , alludes subtly to DT Berchem allegory of America : feathers , pearls and parasol render DT renowned Restoration actress adequately ‘ exotic ’ . 14 Theatrical motions – of hands and other limbs – RB lend DT joint cartouches a dramatic , balletic cogency : arms akimbo on either side of DT title slab , hands gesturing instructively by DT allegorical figures both above and below , and DT scissoring feet of Christian Faith and her Indian protégé alike all serve to animate DT scene . DT swirling dress of Faith , swept up by DT heavenly winds , and her billowing and entirely theatrical shawl ( since this prop MD have been utterly extraneous in DT heavens ) suggest , yet again , tricks of DT stage – and , of course , of highly painterly composition . All of these devices heighten DT drama of DT map and thereby elucidate DT meaning of America . And all of these devices might RB prompt DT question : what is DT message of DT map and DT narrative arch WDT bridges Berchem 's upper and lower cartouches ? DT bond between Faith and America harks back to a proverbial wisdom WDT circulated in late medieval and early modern Europe about DT inverse relation of ‘ god ’ and ‘ gold ’ : wherever DT latter flowed abundantly , PRP was proposed , DT former was typically scarce ( and DT reverse ) . Such a conception of America and her endemic riches ‐cum ‐heathenism justified much of Habsburg Spain 's early colonial action in DT NNP NNP – DT conquest and simultaneous conversion of DT Indians . Yet PRP RB carried an implicit moral message , which gained traction among critics of DT Habsburg Conquista , especially in Northern Europe . And here PRP need to turn to a text , CD of JJ WDT MD have helped viewers read Visscher 's map . A late sixteenth ‐century poem , which captioned DT Dutch and German editions of an engraved allegory of America , commented poignantly on this contradictory relationship between DT European god and American gold ( words WDT punned even more in DT original : god and goud in Dutch ) : Here DT wondrous mineral wealth of America fosters her own decline ; she goes from benighted idolatry to miserable slavery . DT sixteenth ‐century allegory ( engraved by Adriaen Collaert after a design by Maarten de Vos ) expresses sympathy for DT doubly abused Indians . In DT Visscher map , however , with its relatively neutral ‐looking figure of Faith , not obviously Catholic nor Protestant , and with its pan‐colonial vision of DT Americas – NNP France , NNP Netherlands , and English ‐settled Virginia are all engraved into DT space , no less than DT nomenclature of Iberian colonial possessions in South America – DT message pertains to European colonialism and European exoticism writ large . DT map spells out DT evangelical and imperial rise of DT Old NNP in DT NNP . A map , however , even while PRP MD possess plentiful text and even while PRP might be read as and with DT help of text , is certainly not identical to text – PRP is textual and pictorial , not to mention cartographical . PRP is RB material , of course , and while EX MD have been textual and iconographic foundations for such maps as Visscher 's , EX were RB unmistakable evocations of craft and materiality . DT heritage of early modern Dutch cartography goes back not so much to Ptolemy , as Alpers argues , as to DT pioneering labours of Gerard Mercator and Abraham Ortelius , who drew on DT traditions of late ‐medieval mapping – highly pictorial and allegorical products , typically emanating from DT workshops of master illuminators – and on DT NN of craft . 16 Ortelius instinctively placed geography in DT context of art : famously in relationship to history ( ‘ Historiae oculus geographia ’ ) , yet RB in DT sphere of drama . 17 His Theatrum orbis terrarrum not only summons DT language of DT stage , but RB greets its audience on its engraved title page with a recognizable proscenium ( plate 4 ) . Mercator – whose posthumously published atlas RB adapted DT symbols of theatre on its title page – sprang more directly from DT milieu of craft . His main source of income in his early professional NNS came from DT fabrication of mathematical and navigational instruments – this placed him in DT vibrant , metal ‐working ateliers of northern Europe – and , for JJ of DT early cartographic projects with which PRP associate him ( his work with Gemma Frisius and Gaspar à Myrica , for example , on their terrestrial globe ) , he served as a highly skilled engraver of brass plates . He was RB an innovator in DT production of commercial globes ; and he was a remarkable italicist , who composed , designed and printed DT first instruction book of italic script published north of DT Alps . He mastered math and craft , art and ‘ NN ’ . More to DT point , DT actual , tangible maps of Mercator and Ortelius VBP out of their way in these early NNS to emphasize their affiliation with modes of craft and material arts . Both mapmakers ’ ateliers , in producing DT first generation of ‘ craft maps ’ – this is DT geographer John Pickles ’ term for DT highly pictorial , thickly ornamented maps WDT developed in DT late sixteenth ‐century Netherlands18 – make habitual reference to DT process of their maps ’ production and to DT material arts whence PRP came . Thus does Mercator 's Orbis Terrae Compendiosa Descriptio make literal reference to its maker 's background in brass ‐work by DT depiction of an armillary sphere in DT upper centre of DT map 's design , while RB making more figurative allusions to metalwork in DT strapwork surrounding DT armillary ; in DT elaborate fretwork bearing DT JJ hemispheres ; and in DT clever metallic tooling of DT engraved frame WDT encases DT NN map ( plate 5 ) . These devices serve to emphasize DT ‘ thickness ’ of early modern cartography – its broader project of converting three ‐dimensional space into two – while RB invoking DT material arts with which Mercator ( and JJ map illuminators before him ) sought to affiliate himself . Thus , too , does Ortelius offer CD of his most celebrated cartographic images – Abrahami Patriarchae Peregrinatio et Vita ( 1590 ) , which charts DT life and journeys of DT Old Testament patriarch Abraham , DT mapmaker 's namesake – as a trompe l'oeil WDT invokes DT illustrious art of tapestry ( plate 6 ) . Meanwhile , several other graphic techniques make more subtle gestures to various other material arts : twenty ‐two circular medallion vignettes , so ‐called since PRP evoke DT bronze medallions much in fashion at DT NN , do DT heavy ‐lifting narration of Abraham 's life ; two superb cartouches display DT map 's textual apparatus and once again reference DT art of strapwork ( DT interior sample with garlands being a particularly fine example of DT genre ) ; and two decorative masks – ‘ hung ’ on a strapwork cartouche , which is ‘ fastened ’ to a cartographic tapestry – not only lend a sense of depth to this already densely materialized map , but RB allude to DT NN of theatre . DT map , in short , offers a tour de force of spatial manipulation – to VB along with its textual and pictorial narration . Some three ‐quarters of a century later , Nicolaes Visscher and Nicolaes Berchem likewise expended considerable effort in thickening their map . PRP collaboratively layered several illusions of space in DT Americae engraving . Careful hatching around DT edges of DT continents and scattered islands lends a sense of depth to DT hemisphere , a quality further enhanced by DT ‘ shadows ’ cast by DT ships at NN and DT animals on shore ( see plate 1 ) . This imparts to what otherwise might be perceived as flat geographic space DT property of density , and PRP grants DT map 's viewers an optical sense of verticality , as if PRP were observing DT continents from an elevated , almost atmospheric altitude . DT swirling figures of DT upper vignette induce a dizzying lateral movement yet further up ; PRP are now in DT skies , if not quite DT heavens , where shadow and wind still persist ( see plate 3 ) . DT curling ( upper ) cartouche , which carries DT map 's dedication on DT form of a wooden shield , RB plays with DT materiality of DT shield : a shield bears a shield , as PRP were . In DT lower vignette , space moves more horizontally . Here EX is a quality of earthiness , as opposed to DT lofty airiness above , and DT conceit WDT DT ground slopes downward along with DT figures behind DT ‘ slab ’ of cartouche who recede gently into DT horizon ( and presumably further into DT subterranean mines from where America 's gold and silver originate ) ( see plate 2 ) . DT Rise of DT Peer - to - Peer Economy A Peer - to - Peer ( P20 ) Economy is a de-centralized model whereby two individuals interact to buy or sell goods and services directly with each other , without intermediation by a third - party , or without DT use of a company or business . PRP see this being used by companies IN Air BnB , Uber , Craigslist , Sidecar , and Dogvacay among others .
